meanings.definition: To move rhythmically up and down
meanings.sent1: The kids were pumping on the swings at the park.
meanings.sent2: The heart keeps pumping blood throughout the body.
meanings.sent3: The dancers were pumping to the beat of the music.
meanings.sent4: The piston was pumping up and down in the engine.
meanings.sent5: The seesaw was pumping up and down with each child's movement.

meanings.definition: To fill with air or liquid
meanings.sent1: Dad was pumping air into the bicycle tire.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was pumping oil into the car engine.
meanings.sent3: The balloon was pumping up with helium for the party.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter was pumping water into the hose.
meanings.sent5: The swimmer was pumping air into the inflatable pool float.

meanings.sent1: The farmer was pumping water from the well.
meanings.sent2: The engineer was pumping fuel into the aircraft.
meanings.sent3: The gardener was pumping fertilizer into the soil.
meanings.sent4: The worker was pumping air into the scuba tank.
meanings.sent5: The lifeguard was pumping air into the rescue buoy.

meanings.sent1: The company was pumping up its profits this quarter.
meanings.sent2: The excitement was pumping up in the crowd at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The gossip was pumping up around the office.
meanings.sent4: The adrenaline was pumping up as the race began.
meanings.sent5: The energy was pumping up during the sports game.

meanings.sent1: The factory was pumping out products all day.
meanings.sent2: The bakery was pumping out fresh bread for the customers.
meanings.sent3: The printer was pumping out copies of the report.
meanings.sent4: The station was pumping out music for the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen was pumping out delicious smells during dinner preparation.
